channel.title: OSX- Leopard
channel.description: From what ive seen so far, it's a pretty nifty OS, and encourages me to buy a MacBook for $1699. The interface is great and I love the things you can do in it, I also can use it to get away from windows for some time. Post thoughts if youve tried this amazing OS!

item.title: OSX- Leopard
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Quite a few people get ‘network/wireless’ card problems on linux, it just takes some configuring, just search around on the manufacturers website of your network card for support.

On Subject, i am actually ashamed to say i quite like Mac’s, although i wouldn’t pay for one.

Read full topic

item.title: OSX- Leopard
item.dc:creator: @killerman93 killerman93
item.description:
@killerman93 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:155679”]In other words, you won’t take the 15 minutes to install ndiswrapper including fixing any small error you have. irc.freenode.net #ubuntu is very helpful there.

Besides, how hard can it be? download the source from sourceforge, open a terminal in the directory:

./configure
make
make install

Done, the latest ndiswrapper is now installed, congratulations. Now to load the windows driver:

sudo ndiswrapper -i /pathtodriverdirectory/nameofinf.inf

Reboot, enjoy wireless. :)[/quote]

Its what I tried, anyway, OSX is at 5% now, only 1 day and 17h’s left till its done, plus my dads getting me a external HD, so I’ll have plenty of room.
Dont get me wrong I LOVE Ubuntu 7.10, its a great OS, and im definitely keeping it on my PC, its just that the internet isnt working. Hopefully my dad will get me a wired connection for it, then I can be like you guys

Read full topic

item.title: OSX- Leopard
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

In other words, you won’t take the 15 minutes to install ndiswrapper including fixing any small error you have. irc.freenode.net #ubuntu is very helpful there.

Besides, how hard can it be? download the source from sourceforge, open a terminal in the directory:

./configure
make
make install

Done, the latest ndiswrapper is now installed, congratulations. Now to load the windows driver:

sudo ndiswrapper -i /pathtodriverdirectory/nameofinf.inf

Reboot, enjoy wireless.

Read full topic

item.title: OSX- Leopard
item.dc:creator: @killerman93 killerman93
item.description:
@killerman93 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

http://thepiratebay.org/tor/3855637/APPLE.MAC.OSX.LEOPARD.V10.5.ISO-OSX

Its what im doing, and ndiswrapper dosnt like me for some reason and wont install

Read full topic

item.title: OSX- Leopard
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

So buy a $30 dollar wireless USB adapter from wal-mart and it will work as soon as you plug it in. (or spend 15 minutes installing ndiswrapper) Much cheaper than a $1600 dollar piece of shit.

With a little bit of research I found that it takes some slight hacking to install OSX on a real x86 PC, but someone has done all of the hard work for you.

http://forum.osx86scene.com/viewtopic.php?f=16&t=2008&st=0&sk=t&sd=a
http://thepiratebay.org/tor/3855637/APPLE.MAC.OSX.LEOPARD.V10.5.ISO-OSX

Read full topic

item.title: OSX- Leopard
item.dc:creator: @killerman93 killerman93
item.description:
@killerman93 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:2, topic:155679”]Am I mistaken or can’t you install this on a PC now? Making it a completely stupid move to actually purchase an overpriced macbook?

If you want a better OS to get away from windows, give linux a try (I recommend kubuntu or sabayon)[/quote]

Linux= Hates my network card.

Read full topic

If you want a better OS to get away from windows, give linux a try (I recommend kubuntu or sabayon)

From what ive seen so far, it’s a pretty nifty OS, and encourages me to buy a MacBook for $1699. The interface is great and I love the things you can do in it, I also can use it to get away from windows for some time.
